question: Which protocol is used by Azure Storage Queue?
How do you authenticate access to Azure Storage Queue?
What is the maximum size of a message that can be stored in Azure Storage Queue?
What is the purpose of the "Message ID" property in an Azure Storage Queue message?
options: It uniquely identifies a message within a queue
It indicates the time when the message was enqueued
It determines the maximum time a message can remain in the queue
It specifies the visibility timeout for the message

question: Which Azure Storage Queue feature allows you to set a maximum number of times a message can be dequeued?
Which of the following is NOT a valid operation on an Azure Storage Queue?
What happens to messages in an Azure Storage Queue after they are dequeued?
options: They are moved to a separate "Dead Letter Queue"
They are hidden from other consumers for a specified duration
They are marked as processed but remain in the queue

question: What is the purpose of the "Dequeue Count" property in an Azure Storage Queue message?
options: It indicates the number of times a message has been dequeued
It determines the maximum time a message can remain in the queue
It represents the time when the message was enqueued
It specifies the visibility timeout for the message

question: Which of the following is a valid scenario for using Azure Storage Queues?
What is the purpose of the "Time-to-Live (TTL)" property in an Azure Storage Queue message?
options: It determines the maximum time a message can remain in the queue
It represents the time when the message was dequeued
It specifies the visibility timeout for the message
It indicates the total number of messages in the queue

question: What is the purpose of the "Message Retention Policy" for an Azure Storage Queue?
options: It determines the maximum time a message can remain in the queue
It indicates the number of times a message has been dequeued
It represents the time when the message was enqueued
It specifies the visibility timeout for the message

question: What is the purpose of the "Visibility Timeout" property in Azure Storage Queues?
options: It determines the maximum time a message can remain in the queue
It represents the time when the message was dequeued
It specifies the delay before a message is made visible again after being dequeued
It indicates the total number of messages in the queue
